benchmark_details.name: HumanVideo-MME
benchmark_details.overview: HumanVideo-MME is a rigorously curated benchmark designed to provide a more holistic evaluation of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) in human-centric video understanding, encompassing 13 tasks from basic attribute perception to advanced cognitive reasoning across diverse scenarios and video lengths.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate MLLMs on human-centric video understanding by leveraging a diverse range of cognitive tasks and evaluation paradigms.

data.source: Videos sourced from publicly available datasets including UltraVideo and OpenHumanVid, along with manual collection.
data.annotation: Automated question-answer annotation combined with manual quality review.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on task-specific evaluation standards, including multiple-choice and fill-in-the-blank formats.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in understanding and reasoning across human-centric video tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Models show high performance in multiple-choice tasks but significantly drop in open-ended questions.
methodology.validation: The benchmark validated through both automated filtering and multi-stage human review.
